title: Illuminated Agip Motor Oils Sign at No Reserve
description: This illuminated single-sided Agip Motor Oils sign features a translucent panel in yellow, red, black, and white housed within a metal frame. Design elements include Agip logotype and the company’s six-legged dog logo. The sign uses LED illumination and measures approximately 37″ wide by 12″ tall. Hardware for hanging the sign is attached to the top, and it is equipped with 120-volt circuitry and a two-prong wall plug. Acquired by the seller in 2025, this illuminated Agip Motor Oils sign is offered at no reserve in Salem, Oregon.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: Illuminated Agip Motor Oils Sign at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #0.
text: This illuminated single-sided Agip Motor Oils sign features a translucent panel in yellow, red, black, and white housed within a metal frame. Design elements include Agip logotype and the company’s six-legged dog logo. The sign uses LED illumination and measures approximately 37″ wide by 12″ tall. Hardware for hanging the sign is attached to the top, and it is equipped with 120-volt circuitry and a two-prong wall plug. Acquired by the seller in 2025, this illuminated Agip Motor Oils sign is offered at no reserve in Salem, Oregon. Agip S.p.A. was an Italian petroleum enterprise established by the Italian government in 1926 and the six-legged fire-breathing dog logo first appeared circa 1952. The hanging bracket and chains are not included. The rectangular sign features a metal structure and a translucent panel in yellow, red, white, and black. The dimensions for the sign are approximately 37” wide by 12″ tall by 4” deep and it weighs about 10 pounds. The seller notes yellow paint loss around the edges of the translucent panel which can be viewed in the gallery. The sign was retrofitted from a fluorescent bulb to an LED tube light housed within the enclosure and the power cord on the 120-volt circuitry has a two-prong wall plug. The metal enclosure has a pair of D-ring hangers affixed to the top. The sign can also be displayed freestanding as seen in the gallery. You are not connected to real-time updates. html:
This illuminated single-sided Agip Motor Oils sign features a translucent panel in yellow, red, black, and white housed within a metal frame. Design elements include Agip logotype and the company’s six-legged dog logo. The sign uses LED illumination and measures approximately 37″ wide by 12″ tall. Hardware for hanging the sign is attached to the top, and it is equipped with 120-volt circuitry and a two-prong wall plug. Acquired by the seller in 2025, this illuminated Agip Motor Oils sign is offered at no reserve in Salem, Oregon.

Agip S.p.A. was an Italian petroleum enterprise established by the Italian government in 1926 and the six-legged fire-breathing dog logo first appeared circa 1952. The hanging bracket and chains are not included.

The rectangular sign features a metal structure and a translucent panel in yellow, red, white, and black. The dimensions for the sign are approximately 37” wide by 12″ tall by 4” deep and it weighs about 10 pounds. The seller notes yellow paint loss around the edges of the translucent panel which can be viewed in the gallery.

The sign was retrofitted from a fluorescent bulb to an LED tube light housed within the enclosure and the power cord on the 120-volt circuitry has a two-prong wall plug.

The metal enclosure has a pair of D-ring hangers affixed to the top. The sign can also be displayed freestanding as seen in the gallery.
